subject: Wrestling
lead_paragraph: The Brandon (Fla.) High School wrestling team’s national record of 459 consecutive dual victories dating to 1973 has ended. South Dade High School topped Brandon, 32-28, on Saturday night in the finals of the Jim Graves Beat the Streak Tournament at Brandon High. Brandon’s streak began after Jim Graves, for whom the tournament is named, took over as the Eagles’ wrestling coach. Graves coached the team for nine years. The streak included 66 individual state champions and 18 team titles.
